name: Force Recon Storm Landcruiser
desc:
An autonomous machine that applies the principles of naval combat to land battles, a literal "armed ship that cruises on land."
Equipped with Crawler Track Movement Mechanisms, these Landcruisers are normally used to storm enemy positions, where they can pass over rough terrain such as mud and melting snow despite heavy armor and armaments through their excellent load-bearing capabilities and off-road mobility. Force Recon armaments include a multi-barrel automatic gun, allowing this Landcruiser to adjust its tactics to both close quarters and long-range combat. Whether it be long-range observation or obtaining enemy intel in the midst of fearsome firefights, this Landcruiser model is more than up to the task.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>The Silent Command</color>
Interrupt the enemy's progress.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

dropMaterial.name: Mora
dropMaterial.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

dropMaterial.name: Broken Drive Shaft
dropMaterial.desc:
The drive shaft of a Landcruiser destroyed in battle.
Even the most precise craftsmanship cannot withstand excessive wear, just as the most lofty ideals cannot bring back those who've died in vain for someone else's cause. Moreover, mass-produced components can hardly be called precise, and mass-produced ideals can hardly be considered true ideals.

dropMaterial.name: Reinforced Drive Shaft
dropMaterial.desc:
The reinforced drive shaft of a Landcruiser.
It took countless reports of destruction to bring about this insignificant improvement. In a sense, the administrative system of the Royal Armory Palace is several times more complex than the machinery it builds. After all, even the most advanced Landcruisers don't take months or even years to build.

dropMaterial.name: Precision Drive Shaft
dropMaterial.desc:
The drive shaft of a Landcruiser refined by the Design Bureau.
On the blueprints drawn by the engineers of the north, this unassuming part was once the flawless embodiment of glory and technological advancement, its small metal body encapsulating the wisdom of countless generations. Now it lies in the cold dirt, waiting to be recycled once more.
